title: Master's Degree
text:
Specialized in control systems, optimization, and intelligent systems, with applications to self-driving cars, vehicular vision systems, and cloud computing. Completed graduate-level coursework in Computer Control Systems, Adaptive Control Systems, Optimization Theory and Applications, Sensing and Intelligent Systems, Cloud Computing and Big Data Analytics, Deep Learning and Digital Signal Processing, and Embedded Operating Systems. Conducted academic dissertation research with an average grade of 90.89/100, achieving a coursework GPA equivalent of 91.78/100.

Engaged in seminars and interdisciplinary projects, including cultural applications for the National Palace Museum and teaching technique practice. Developed strong technical foundations in optimization, artificial intelligence, and embedded systems, complemented by training in research ethics and academic writing in English.
